Main Page | Namespace List | Class Hierarchy | Alphabetical List | Class List | File List | Namespace Members | Class Members | File Members

Skin Class Reference

#include <Skin.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A skin defines the graphical representation (colors, images, fonts, layout, etc.) and some of the user input behavior of the whole Glaziery system and all its components (windows, client areas, fields, ...).
.

Skins define the default sizes of components and add listeners to the components to add behavior. The glaziery components only contain representation-less states such as the size or whether the component is visible. The drawing is performed by the skin, using the platform adapter selected on desktop initialization. Application developers have to choose a skin before starting to design forms (field area dialog windows), because the sizes of components differ from skin to skin.

Most pointer event handling on components is defined by the skin using widgets. A widget (window gadget) is a small part of a component, an interactive graphical object, with skin-defined pointer behavior. Since widgets are event targets, they general pointer handling applies. Examples for widgets are the window title bar, the window close widget, and the selector pull-down widget. Skins create widgets in their setup methods and add them to the components.

A skin is selected when initializing the Glaziery system using Desktop::createInstance(). The skin cannot be changes after that point. Glaziery provides a reference skin, the SimpleSkin, and it encourages you to implement your own one.

See also:
Desktop

Desktop::createInstance()

Component

Widget

SimpleSkin

virtual void addKeyVisualizationEffect (  const String &  keyName,
bool  atFocus = true
)  [virtual]
 

Creates a new effect for visualizating a key press in a tutorial.

Parameters:
keyName A string containing the character or key name.
atFocus Whether to show the effect at the focus window or popup. false shows it at the pointer position. Defaults to true.

virtual void addPopupCreateEffect (  Popup *  popup  )  [virtual]
 

Creates a new effect for creating a popup and adds it to the Desktop.

The effect does nothing but visual effects. If this skin does not emit effects, the method does nothing.

Parameters:
popup The popup to be created visually.

virtual void addPopupDestroyEffect (  Popup *  popup  )  [virtual]
 

Creates a new effect for destroying a popup and adds it to the Desktop.

The effect must at least destroy the popup. If this skin does not emit effects, the method must destroy the popup directly.

Parameters:
popup The popup to be destroyed with or without effect.
See also:
Component::destroy()

virtual void addWindowCreateEffect (  Window *  window  )  [virtual]
 

Creates a new effect for creating a window and adds it to the Desktop.

The effect does nothing but visual effects. If this skin does not emit effects, the method does nothing.

Parameters:
window The window to be created visually.

virtual void addWindowDestroyEffect (  Window *  window  )  [virtual]
 

Creates a new effect for destroying a window and adds it to the Desktop.

Parameters:

virtual void fillScrollerInfo (  ScrollerInfo &  info,
ScrollingArea *  area
)  [virtual]
 

Fills a given scroller info according to the properties of a given scrolling area.

Vector &  topLeftSize,
Vector &  bottomRightSize
)  [virtual]

The sizes are consulted to calculate the remaining content size.

Parameters:

topLeftSize The vector to be filled with the top and left sizes.

virtual void getTabbingAreaFrameSizes (  TabbingArea *  area,
Vector &  topLeftSize,
Vector &  bottomRightSize
)  [virtual]
 

Fills two vectors with the widths and heights of the top-left and bottom-right borders of a tabbing area's frame.

The frame contains the tabs themselves, and all the additional space that reduces the size of the sub client areas (panes). This size is consulted e.g. to calculate the client area size.

Parameters:
area The tabbing area to return the frame sizes of.
topLeftSize The vector to be filled with the top and left sizes.
bottomRightSize The vector to be filled with the bottom and right sizes.

This is the space the field requires if it was not scrolling and displaying its entire content.

Returns:
The size of the text field content.

Returns:

virtual void initialize (   )  [virtual]
 

Initializes the skin.

This method is called after the skin and graphics adapter have been set, and after the platform adapter has been initialized. The method is called by the desktop, so do not call it manually.

Note:
Perform all initialization operations here that require an initialized platform adapter (such as image or font retrieval).
See also:
PlatformAdapter

Desktop::createInstance()

virtual void shutDown (   )  [virtual]
 

Shuts down the skin.

This method is called before the platform adapter has been shut down, so you can still use its methods. The method is called by the desktop, so do not call it manually.

See also:
PlatformAdapter

Desktop::destroyInstance()
